### Problem

<p>The weight of an array is defined as the difference between the maximum and minimum element of the array. For example, the weight of the array [3, 7, 1, 2] is (7 - 1) = 6, the weight of the array [2] is (2 - 2) = 0, the weight of an empty array is 0.<br>
You are given an array A of length N. You have to divide the elements of A into two subsequences S1, and S2 (one of S1, S2 can be empty) such that:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Each element of A belongs to one of S1 and S2.</li>
	<li>The sum of weights of the two subsequences is maximum.</li>
</ul>
<p>Find the maximum possible sum of weights of the two subsequences.</p>
<p><strong>Input format</strong></p>
<ul>
	<li>The first line contains <em>T</em> denoting the number of test cases. The description of <em>T</em> test cases is as follows:</li>
	<li>For each test case:
	<ul>
		<li>The first line contains <em>N</em> denoting the size of array <em>A.</em></li>
		<li>The second line contains <em>N</em> space-separated integers <em>A[1], A[2], ....., A[N]</em> - denoting the elements of <em>A</em>.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Output format</strong><br>
For each test case, print the maximum possible sum of weights of the two subsequences.</p>
<p><strong>Constraints</strong></p>
<p><svg width="53.699ex" height="12.943ex" viewBox="0 -977.9 23120.1 5572.5" role="img" focusable="false" style="vertical-align: -10.671ex;" aria-hidden="true"><defs><path stroke-width="1" <table>
    <thead>
        <th>Sample Input</th>
        <th>Sample Output</th>
    </thead>
    <tbody valign="top">
        <td>1<br>3<br>1 2 3</td>
        <td>2</td>
    </tbody>
</table>
<p>Time Limit: 1<br>
Memory Limit: 256<br>
Source Limit:</p>

### Explanation

<p><strong>Test case 1:</strong> One possible division is [1, 3], [2] Here the total weight is = (3 - 1) + (2 - 2) = 2.. </p>
